vulnerable_code:
SecureRandom random = new SecureRandom();
int x = random.nextInt();
description: Using SecureRandom without specifying a cryptographically strong pseudo-random number generator (CSPRNG) or using it improperly might result in insufficient entropy and weak random values.
recommendation: Specify a strong CSPRNG algorithm explicitly while creating SecureRandom instance, e.g., SecureRandom random = SecureRandom.getInstanceStrong();
